messages.body: $TSLA https://qz.com/1070609/beyond-tesla-the-surprising-investment-opportunities-created-by-electric-cars/

links.title: The surprising ways to cash in on the electric-car boom
links.description: This year, Tesla's stock price has surged 66%. And buying shares in Elon Musk's company is far from the only way to cash in on the future of electric cars. Investors are sending the prices of the raw materials used to make lithium-ion batteries rapidly higher on hopes that demand for electric cars surges.

links.title: Tesla shares to plunge nearly 40% due to weak Model 3 production, Goldman predicts
links.description: Peter Parks | AFP | Getty Images Tesla's third quarter Model 3 delivery miss is further evidence the electric car maker will have difficulties ramping up manufacturing for the vehicle, according to a top Wall Street firm. In the third quarter, Tesla delivered 26,150 total vehicles and just 220 Model 3 cars versus the FactSet estimates of 25,860 and 1,260, respectively.

message.body: $TSLA "Elon Musk says that, if given the green light, he can power Puerto Rico" http://www.marketwatch.com/story/elon-musk-says-that-if-given-the-green-light-he-can-power-puerto-rico-2017-10-05

links.title: Elon Musk says that, if given the green light, he can power Puerto Rico
links.description: When Scott Stapf read a story about Puerto Rico's "once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to rethink how it gets electricity," he had a thought: Could Elon Musk go in and rebuild the country's electricity system with independent solar and battery systems? He probably didn't expect Musk to answer... but he did.
